entry.title: Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi speaks at Golden Apricot film festival in Yerevan

media:group.media:title: Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi speaks at Golden Apricot film festival in Yerevan
media:group.media:description:
In a rare public appearance, renowned Iranian filmmaker and screenwriter Jafar Panahi sits down with Russian film critic Anton Dolin and attendees at this year‚Äôs Golden Apricot International Film Festival in Yerevan, Armenia. Panahi fields audience questions on the art of filmmaking amid state censorship and his experience in prison in Iran. Panahi was recognized as a guest of honor at this year‚Äôs Golden Apricot, marking his first festival visit after 14 years of imprisonment and house arrest in Iran.
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’©

entry.title: No official complaints from Russia over brandy quality, Armenia says: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: No official complaints from Russia over brandy quality, Armenia says: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia said it has not received any official complaints from Russia about the quality of the country‚Äôs multimillion-dollar brandy exports, after Moscow-based consumer rights and lobbying groups claimed the spirits do not meet international safety standards. üìç Washington told CivilNet it is studying a request by Yerevan to reach a Section 123 Agreement, which would pave the way for the United States to design and build a new nuclear power plant in Armenia to replace the country‚Äôs aging facility at Metsamor. Read more: https://shorturl.at/CFsz4 üìç Armenia revised down its GDP growth figure for last year to 8.3% from 8.7%, shaving off some $134 million in value from its original estimate. Armenia also revised down its GDP growth figure for the first quarter of this year to 6.6% from 9.2%. That means Armenia‚Äôs economy is not on track to meet the government‚Äôs target of 7% growth for this year.
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #civilnetbusiness
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: Putin holds phone call with Pashinyan to discuss recent trip to Baku

media:group.media:title: Putin holds phone call with Pashinyan to discuss recent trip to Baku
media:group.media:description:
üìç Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan insisted Armenia‚Äôs declaration of independence is not part of the country‚Äôs constitution, in an apparent attempt to rebuff demands by Azerbaijan to change the constitution. üìç Russian President Vladimir Putin told Pashinyan he remains willing to help mediate a normalization deal with Azerbaijan, following up on talks earlier this week with Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev in Baku. üìç Bahruz Samadov, an Azerbaijani researcher and freelance journalist known for his peace advocacy and criticism of Aliyev‚Äôs regime, was detained in Baku, reportedly on treason charges.
Credits: Ruptly
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #dailyarmenia

entry.title: State Department tells CivilNet US considering nuclear pact with Armenia

media:group.media:title: State Department tells CivilNet US considering nuclear pact with Armenia
media:group.media:description:
üìç The State Department told CivilNet it is studying a request by Armenia to reach a Section 123 Agreement, which would pave the way for the United States to design and build a new nuclear power plant in Armenia to replace the country‚Äôs aging facility at Metsamor. Read more: https://shorturl.at/CFsz4 üìç Belarus reprimanded a senior Armenian diplomat after demonstrators hurled fresh produce at its embassy in Yerevan to protest mocking remarks by Belarus‚Äô president. üìç The spokesperson for Russia‚Äôs Foreign Ministry slammed what she called efforts by Armenia to ‚Äúblame others for its own mistakes and strategic miscalculations.‚Äù üìç Armenia congratulated Iran‚Äôs new foreign minister, Abbas Araghchi, for his appointment. üìç Insights with Eric Hacopian: https://youtu.be/z44OEWohCe0
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: Putin and Aliyev plot their next moves in Baku

media:group.media:title: Putin and Aliyev plot their next moves in Baku
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of CivilNet‚Äôs Insights series, host Eric Hacopian discusses the state of normalization talks between Armenia and Azerbaijan and breaks down Russian President Vladimir Putin‚Äôs visit earlier this week to Azerbaijan. Eric also provides an update on efforts by oligarch Gagik Tsarukyan to build the world‚Äôs tallest statue of Jesus on a mountain outside of Yerevan, a project that has become a lightning rod for controversy both in Armenia and across the diaspora.

entry.title: APRI Armenia, une nouvelle approche des think tanks arm√©niens

media:group.media:title: APRI Armenia, une nouvelle approche des think tanks arm√©niens
media:group.media:description:
Fond√© en 2022, l'Institut de recherche en politique appliqu√©e d'Arm√©nie (APRI Arm√©nie) est un groupe de r√©flexion ind√©pendant qui propose ses conseils au service du renforcement de l‚ÄôEtat arm√©nien. Sa vice-pr√©sidente Anahide Pilibossian fait le point sur ce qui fait l‚ÄôADN de son institut et revient sur deux ans de r√©alisations.
